title: Get Creative Features Response
description: Response payload for get_creative_features task. Returns feature values for the evaluated creative.

results.description: Feature values for the evaluated creative

items.title: Creative Feature Result
items.description: A single feature evaluation result for a creative. Uses the same value structure as property-feature-value (value, confidence, expires_at, etc.).

value.description: The feature value. Type depends on feature definition: boolean for binary, number for quantitative, string for categorical.

unit.description: Unit of measurement for quantitative values (e.g., 'percentage', 'score')

expires_at.description: When this evaluation expires and should be refreshed

methodology_version.description: Version of the methodology used to evaluate this feature

details.description: Additional vendor-specific details about this evaluation

ext.title: Extension Object
ext.description: Extension object for platform-specific, vendor-namespaced parameters. Extensions are always optional and must be namespaced under a vendor/platform key (e.g., ext.gam, ext.roku). Used for custom capabilities, partner-specific configuration, and features being proposed for standardization.

detail_url.description: URL to the vendor's full assessment report. The vendor controls what information is disclosed and access control.

errors.description: Field must not be present in success response

context.title: Context Object
context.description: Opaque correlation data that is echoed unchanged in responses. Used for internal tracking, UI session IDs, trace IDs, and other caller-specific identifiers that don't affect protocol behavior. Context data is never parsed by AdCP agents - it's simply preserved and returned.

items.description: Standard error structure for task-specific errors and warnings

retry_after.description: Seconds to wait before retrying the operation
